pn = function(c,d){
    cc = c[c!=0]
    dd = d[c!=0]
    p = paste0("{",cc,"}x^{",dd,"}",collapse="+")
    p = gsub("x^{0}","",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("x^{1}","x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{-","-{",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{1}x","+x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("-{1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{-1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{1}x","x",p,fixed=T)
    return(p)
}

Question
========

A standard-form quadratic function has three parameters $a$, $b$, and $c$:

$$y=ax^2+bx+c$$

An important quantity we can calculate is the [discriminant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quadratic_equation#Discriminant).

$$D~=~b^2-4ac$$

Calculate the discriminant of the following quadratic function:

$$y~=~`r pn(c(a,b,c),2:0)`$$




Solution
========

Identify the coefficients.

$$a=`r a`$$
$$b=`r b`$$
$$c=`r c`$$

Use the formula for the disciminant.

$$D=(`r b`)^2-4(`r a`)(`r c`)$$

$$D=`r D`$$

`r wrd2`
